jparsec.graph

Enum ChartSeriesElement.REGRESSION

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<ChartSeriesElement.REGRESSION>
      • jparsec.graph.ChartSeriesElement.REGRESSION
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ChartSeriesElement.REGRESSION>
    Enclosing class:
    ChartSeriesElement

    public static enum ChartSeriesElement.REGRESSION
extends java.lang.Enum<ChartSeriesElement.REGRESSION>
    The regression types. They are used only for x-y charts.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      GENERIC_FIT
      ID constant for a general regression fit using GenericFit class.
      LINEAR
      ID Constant for linear regression.
      LINEAR_INTERPOLATION
      ID Constant for linear interpolation (no regression).
      NONE
      ID Constant for no regression.
      POLYNOMIAL
      ID Constant for a polynomial regression.
      REGRESSION_CUSTOM
      ID constant for a general regression fit using Regression class.
      SPLINE_INTERPOLATION
      ID Constant for spline interpolation (no regression).

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • NONE

        public static final ChartSeriesElement.REGRESSION NONE
        ID Constant for no regression.

      • LINEAR

        public static final ChartSeriesElement.REGRESSION LINEAR
        ID Constant for linear regression.

      • POLYNOMIAL

        public static final ChartSeriesElement.REGRESSION POLYNOMIAL
        ID Constant for a polynomial regression. Polynomial degree is 2 by default.

      • SPLINE_INTERPOLATION

        public static final ChartSeriesElement.REGRESSION SPLINE_INTERPOLATION
        ID Constant for spline interpolation (no regression).

      • LINEAR_INTERPOLATION

        public static final ChartSeriesElement.REGRESSION LINEAR_INTERPOLATION
        ID Constant for linear interpolation (no regression).

      • GENERIC_FIT

        public static final ChartSeriesElement.REGRESSION GENERIC_FIT
        ID constant for a general regression fit using GenericFit class. The functions must be set after selecting this option.

      • REGRESSION_CUSTOM

        public static final ChartSeriesElement.REGRESSION REGRESSION_CUSTOM
        ID constant for a general regression fit using Regression class. The custom function and initial estimates must be set after selecting this option.

    • Method Detail

      • values

        public static ChartSeriesElement.REGRESSION[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (ChartSeriesElement.REGRESSION c : ChartSeriesElement.REGRESSION.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)

      • setCustomRegressionFitFunctions

        public void setCustomRegressionFitFunctions(java.lang.String function,
                                   double[] initialEstimates)
        Sets the custom function used to fit the data in case the custom regression fit option is selected. See Regression class.
        Parameters:
        function - The function.
        initialEstimates - The initial estimates for the fitting parameters.

      • setGenericFitFunctions

        public void setGenericFitFunctions(java.lang.String[] functions)
        Sets the generic functions used to fit the data in case the generic fit option is selected. They should be 3. See GenericFit class.
        Parameters:
        functions - The functions.

      • getGenericFitFunctions

        public java.lang.String[] getGenericFitFunctions()
        Returns the functions for a generic fit.
        Returns:
        The fitting functions.

      • getCustomRegressionFitFunction

        public java.lang.String getCustomRegressionFitFunction()
        Returns the functions for a custom regression fit.
        Returns:
        The fitting function.

      • getCustomRegressionFitInitialEstimates

        public double[] getCustomRegressionFitInitialEstimates()
        Returns the initial estimates for the fitting parameters.
        Returns:
        The initial estimates.

      • getShowEquation

        public boolean getShowEquation()
        Returns if the fitting formula should be shown or not.
        Returns:
        True or false.

      • setShowEquation

        public void setShowEquation(boolean show)
        Sets if the fitting formula should be shown or not.
        Parameters:
        show - True or false.

      • getShowRegression

        public boolean getShowRegression()
        Returns if the regression series should be shown or not.
        Returns:
        True or false.

      • setShowRegression

        public void setShowRegression(boolean show)
        Sets if the regression series should be shown or not.
        Parameters:
        show - True or false.

      • getEquation

        public java.lang.String getEquation()
        Returns the equation string.
        Returns:
        The equation.

      • setEquation

        public void setEquation(java.lang.String eq)
        Sets a custom value for the equation string.
        Parameters:
        eq - The equation.

      • getEquationValues

        public double[] getEquationValues()
        Returns the set of values representing the fit. For a line the values will be y for x = 0, and the slope, for a polynomial its coefficients.
        Returns:
        The values for the fitting formula.

      • setEquationValues

        public void setEquationValues(double[] val,
                     double[] err)
        Sets the values for the coefficients of the fitting formula. The equation formula is modified only if it is null or empty string (and not a generic custom fitting formula).
        Parameters:
        val - The coefficients for the fitting formula. For a line the values will be y for x = 0, and the slope (use better the method for a linear fit instance in this case), for a polynomial its coefficients.
        err - The coefficients for the errors.

      • getEquationValuesErrors

        public double[] getEquationValuesErrors()
        Returns the set of values representing the errors of the fitting values. For a line the values will be dy for x = 0, and the slope error, for a polynomial the errors of its coefficients.
        Returns:
        The values for the errors of the parameters of the fitting formula.

      • setEquationFromLinearFit

        public void setEquationFromLinearFit(LinearFit fit)
        Sets the fitting values from a linear fit instance. The equation formula is modified only if it is null or empty string (and not a generic custom fitting formula).
        Parameters:
        fit - The instance for a fit to a straight line.

      • getLinearFit

        public LinearFit getLinearFit()
        Returns the linear fit instance for the fitting formula. In case the values were not set using a linear fit instance, this method will return null.
        Returns:
        The linear fit instance, or null if no one was used to define the fit.

      • getPolynomialDegree

        public int getPolynomialDegree()
        Returns the degree of the polynomial for the fit. Note this value is not necessarily related to the number of coefficients in the parameters of the fit, since this value can be changed.
        Returns:
        The polynomial degree.

      • setPolynomialDegree

        public void setPolynomialDegree(int degree)
        Sets the degree of the polynomial for the fit. It should be set before the chart is created.
        Parameters:
        degree - The degree of the fitting polynomial.

      • getPolynomialFit

        public Polynomial getPolynomialFit()
        Returns a polynomial instance representing the fitting formula.
        Returns:
        The fitting polynomial.

      • getGenericFit

        public GenericFit getGenericFit()
        Returns a GenericFit instance representing the fitting formula.
        Returns:
        The fitting formula.

      • regressionDone

        public boolean regressionDone()
        Returns true if the regression was performed, false otherwise. More exactly, this method will return true if the equation values are not null.
        Returns:
        True or false.

      • getColor

        public java.awt.Color getColor()
        Returns the color to show the regression. Default color is the same as the series to apply the regression.
        Returns:
        The color, or null if it is not set.

      • setColor

        public void setColor(java.awt.Color col)
        Sets the color of the regression. Default color is the same as the series to apply the regression.
        Parameters:
        col - The color.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Resets all fields to their default values for this enum constant.

      • clearRegression

        public void clearRegression()
        Resets the regression to force it to be calculated again.
